definition: Ming Dynasty (1368-1644)/surname Ming/Ming (c. 2000 BC), fourth of the legendary Flame Emperors, 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God
bright/opposite: dark 暗[an4]/(of meaning) clear/to understand/next/public or open/wise/generic term for a sacrifice to the gods

sentences.english: I can easily look up tracking information or read a postmark, you know.
sentences.chinese: 这通过查看邮寄信息或邮戳就可心知肚明。

sentences.english: HERODIAS: Thou knowest well that it is true.
sentences.chinese: 你心知肚明，那千真万确。

sentences.english: Ah, you will miss us, right well we know.
sentences.chinese: 啊，你将思念我们，我们心知肚明。

sentences.english: It is also not going to happen. China surely knows that.
sentences.chinese: 这种情况也不会发生，中国对此肯定心知肚明。

sentences.english: After all, they are well aware of the legal questions raised by their work.
sentences.chinese: 毕竟，大家都心知肚明这份工作中涉及的法律问题。

sentences.english: The Labor Party knows all too well, history is written by the victors.
sentences.chinese: 历史是由胜利者书写的，工党对此心知肚明。

sentences.english: Everybody sort of knew they were against logging.
sentences.chinese: 大家都心知肚明，欧文斯夫妇是在反对伐木业。

definition: to know the score (idiom)/to be well aware of the situation
perspicacious person/sb with a discerning eye/sighted person (as opposed to blind)
to lay bare in a few words/to expose with a word/to point out bluntly
to lay bare (actual facts, secrets etc)/to reveal

pinyin: zheng1 yi1 zhi1 yan3 bi4 yi1 zhi1 yan3

definition: not to mention (idiom); to say not one word/fig. to omit mention (of a non-person or embarrassing topic)/to censor
lips sealed and not saying anything (idiom); fig. to omit mention (of a non-person or embarrassing topic)/to censor
to be very clear about sth (idiom)
needless to say/it goes without saying
as matters stand/things having reached this stage
